abstract: Activist hedge funds have grown more ambitious, taking on larger companies and seeking long-term change over short-term profit, unlike raiders of the past.
snippet: Activist hedge funds have grown more ambitious, taking on larger companies and seeking long-term change over short-term profit, unlike raiders of the past.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft executives faced an unusual challenge in April when a $12 billion hedge fund, ValueAct, announced that it had bought a nearly $2 billion stake in the company with the intention of shaking things up.

headline.main: With Huge War Chests, Activist Investors Tackle Big Companies
headline.print_headline: With Huge War Chests, Activist Investors Tackle Big Companies

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Julie Creswell
